headline: Taliban Attacks Ravage Pomegranate Country
text: ARGHANDAB, Afghanistan — Crack a pomegranate in half and its blood-red seed-filled chambers make it look almost like a broken heart. In Arghandab district, which in Afghanistan is almost synonymous with the fruit, a Taliban offensive has cut the heart out of the harvest season, leaving farming families desperate.
snippet: An incursion that devastated a prized crop shows the loss and uncertainty that many Afghans endure.
